question.body: What would happen to a person who had abnormally high Ca 2+ concentration in their sarcoplasm?

multiple_choice.choice: They would not be able to contract their muscles.
The action potential would not be propagated.
The troponin would not let the myosin bind.
They would have unwanted muscle contractions.

response.feedback: Incorrect. With excess Ca 2+ there would be unwanted muscle contractions.
Incorrect. Na ions are involved in propagating the action potential not calcium.
Incorrect. Ca 2+ will allow the myosin to bind with actin.
Correct. Too much Ca 2+ will allow the myosin to bind the actin at unwanted times resulting in unwanted muscle contraction.
